revised_title: Researches on Tides: Ninth Series - Deduction of Tide Laws from Short Observations
tldr: The author investigates the possibility of deducing the laws of tides from short series of observations, using data from Plymouth and Bristol. The study finds that a regular form and good approximation for the semimenstrual inequality can be obtained from one year of observations, and the lunar parallax corrections can be determined from a series of three to four years. The lunar declination corrections are more irregular but become apparent in a series of four to five years.
